SEARCH
Package model

Class Maps

java.lang.Object
model.Maps
public class Maps extends Object
This represents the game map containing the tiles, doors, and inventory items to be picked up. The map is defined with a 2D grid with each object stored in a corresponding 2D array.
Version:
1.1
Author:
Melangelo Guanzon, Anton Galido

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Maps(Tile[][] grid, Door[][] doors, Item[][] items, int width, int height)
    Constructs the map object that holds all the inventory items as well as the doors and tiles within a level.

  • Constructor Details

    • Maps

      public Maps(Tile[][] grid, Door[][] doors, Item[][] items, int width, int height)
      Constructs the map object that holds all the inventory items as well as the doors and tiles within a level.
      Parameters:
      grid - The 2D array representing the layout of the map
      doors - 2D array representing the containing doors in the map
      items - 2D array representing the different items on the map (Microchips, keys, boots)
      width - map width
      height - map height

  • Method Details

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(int x, int y)
      Returns the tile at the specified position.

      pre-condition: x and y coordinates are within the map bounds post-condition: returns the Tile object at the given coordinates without modifying the map

      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate
      y - The y coordinate
      Returns:
      the grid or tile object at the specified coordinates

    • getGrid

      public Tile[][] getGrid()
      Returns the 2D array of tiles representing the level's grid.

      This grid can be accessed by the GUI to display the map and connect the default UI to the new graphical interface.

      Returns:
      a 2D array of tile objects.

    • setTile

      public void setTile(int x, int y, Tile tile)
      Sets a tile at the specified position.

      pre-condition: both coordinates are within bound and tile is NOT null post-condition: the specified grid position is updated with the new tile

      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate
      y - The y coordinate
      tile - the tile object to be set

    • setStartPosition

      public void setStartPosition(int x, int y)
      Sets the start position of the player on the map.

      This is primarily for the teleport tile feature to set them back.

      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Returns the map width.
      Returns:
      width value

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Returns the map height.
      Returns:
      height value

    • getPlayerStartX

      public int getPlayerStartX()
      Returns the starting x coordinate in the map
      Returns:
      x coordinate

    • getPlayerStartY

      public int getPlayerStartY()
      Returns the starting y coordinate in the map
      Returns:
      y coordinate

    • getDoorAt

      public Door getDoorAt(int x, int y)
      Returns a specific door.
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate
      y - The y coordinate
      Returns:
      the specified door at the specific coordinates

    • getItemAt

      public Item getItemAt(int x, int y)
      Returns a specific item.
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate
      y - The y coordinate
      Returns:
      the specified item at the specific coordinates

    • getDoors

      public Door[][] getDoors()
      Returns the 2D array of all the doors at the map.
      Returns:
      the 2D array of the door objects

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem(Item item)
      Removes an item from the map after it's collected.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to be removed.

      precondition: the item exists on the map. postcondition: Item is marked as collected and the corresponding tile is replaced.

    • isValidPosition

      public boolean isValidPosition(int x, int y)
      Returns true or false if the given coordinates is a valid position.

      pre-condition: x and y should be integers post-condition: returns boolean (true or false) if it's in a valid position (in bounds)

      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate
      y - The y coordinate
      Returns:
      true if the position is valid (in bounds), or false if not

    • findExitPosition

      public Tile findExitPosition()
      Returns the position of the Exit tile.

      Pre-condition: Grid is initialized and populated with Tile objects. Post-condition: Returns the Tile representing the exit if found, therwise returns null.

      Returns:
      the tile object representing the exit, null if it's not found
